page.title: 08Oaker Tree
page.content: Will Shores tree was planted by Will Shore.It is a sycamore tree.Will Shore was one of two brothers.They both planted trees.Will lived a normal life but his brother died and his tree died as well.There is a poem written about the trees when they were first planted.This was written as the poet was driving along the A6 in 1828.The first line says 'Tis said that to the brow of yon fair hill'. The hill the poet is talking about is Oaker Hill. In summer we slide on cardboard down the slopes and in winter we sledge. When it is snowy we can see rabbit and fox tracks.There are many walks on Oaker Hill.In 1979 the residents of Oaker planted an American Oak to replace the tree planted in Jubilee year that had died.
